description:
Change of use of the first second, third and fourth floors
of 33-41 Charlotte Street and 53-57 Rathbone Street from
restaurant and office use to office use (Class B1), and the
creation of four self-contained flats on the upper floors
of 39 and 41 Charlotte Street alterations at rear second
floor levels; roof extensions to 39 and 41 Charlotte Street
and on the Rathbone Street elevation of the main building as
well as associated servicing arrangements,
as shown by drawing numbers:  617/S12, /S1.A, /S2.A, /S3.A,
/S4.A, /S5.A, /S6.A, /S7.A, /S8, /S9, /S10, /S11, /20F,
/21F, /22H, /23H, /24H, /25H, /26G, /27E, /28D, /29C, /30D
and /31D.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Details of the elevations at ground floor level, including
    shopfronts and new entrances shall not be other than have
    been submitted to and approved in writing by the Council
    before the relevant part of the development is begun. The
    development shall be completed in accordance with the
    details thereby approved.

Condition : 2 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than shall have
    been submitted to and approved by the Council before any
    work on the site is commenced. The development shall be
    completed in accordance with the details thereby approved.

Condition : 3 - No pipes or plumbing, other than rainwater pipes, shall be
    fixed on the external face of the building.

Condition : 4 - No area of flat roof other than that marked 'roof terrace'
    and shown on drawing number 617/23G hereby permitted shall
    be converted or used as a terrace or other amenity space
    without the prior written consent of the Council.

Condition : 5 - The existing concrete chimney shall be demolished and the
    area of building around it made good, before any of the uses
    hereby permitted as part this development are begun.

Condition : 6 - No air handling equipment, plant or tank enclosures etc...
    other than that shown on the drawings hereby permitted,
    shall be erected or constructed on any external part of the
    building.

Condition : 7 - Details of the appearance of the plant on the flat roof
    at second floor level to the rear of Goodge Street, as well
    as method for its screening and enclosure, shall be
    submitted to and approved in writing by the Council before
    that part of the development is begun.

Condition : 8 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable
    room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall
    be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing
    background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such
    locations. Where the noise form the plant and machinery is
    tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be
    at least 10 dB(A).

Condition : 9 - For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz-8KHz
    inclusive, noise from all plant and machinery shall at all
    times add not more than 1 decibel to the ambient noise level
    expressed as L90 in the same octave band as measured 1 metre
    outside the window of any residential premises.

Condition : 10 - The servicing bay shown on drawing number 617/21F shall be
    provided, permanently retained and made available for the
    development hereby permitted. All servicing of the site
    shall take place within this bay.

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 12 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 13 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 15 - In order to protect the character and appearance of the
    conservation area.

Condition : 16 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 18 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 19 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 20 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally.

Condition : 21 - The details required pursuant to Condition(s) 1 and 2 should
    be submitted with the attached approval of details
    application form together with 5 sets of drawings and any
    other supporting information.

Condition : 22 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939.

Condition : 23 - The Council supports schemes for the recycling of bottles
    and cans and encourages all hotels, restaurants, wine bars
    and public houses to do so as well. Further information can
    be obtained by telephoning the Council's Street Environment
    Service (Recycling) on 020-7974 1553.
